item.title: Sapling planted in unsuitable plot, 13th July
item.description:
This sapling replaced a tree that was vandalised last year. The previous tree had not thrived in the plot. The thirty year old tree had barely grown. This sapling will suffer the same demise as the plot is has not been imptoved in any way. The surrounding tarmac, weighed down by an iron bench will not allow for growth. The plot is in the court yard of Old Pye Street Estate, Peabody Trust.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Pye Street, Millbank, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cumberland Terrace London NW1 4NB, 13th July
item.description:
Cumberland Terrace, London NW1 4NB I am reporting a serious concern about pedestrian safety on Cumberland Terrace London NW1 4NB. I’ve witnessed and personally experienced several near misses where drivers have ignored zebra crossings or overtaken buses that have stopped to let pedestrians cross. This is happening despite the posted 20mph speed limit, which many cars appear to disregard. This issue is especially dangerous for older residents in our area, who may be less able to react quickly. Just recently, I was nearly hit by a speeding vehicle while crossing. It’s a recurring problem and feels like a tragedy waiting to happen. I kindly urge the council to: Increase speed enforcement or camera monitoring in this area and install additional signage to discourage overtaking. Many thanks,

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albany Street, Chalk Farm, London
Report on FixMyStreet
